meanings.definition: A person who writes or composes epigrams.
meanings.sent1: The talented epigrammatists at the poetry club always make us laugh with their witty verses.
meanings.sent2: The bookshelf was filled with works by famous epigrammatists from different eras.
meanings.sent3: The group of epigrammatists decided to have a competition to see who could come up with the funniest one-liner.
meanings.sent4: Her words cut through the silence like a skilled epigrammatist, leaving everyone in stitches.
meanings.sent5: The young students were inspired by the epigrammatists in their English class to try writing their own clever sayings.

meanings.sent1: The library had a special section dedicated to the epigrammatists, showcasing their unique styles.
meanings.sent2: In the museum, visitors could admire the portraits of famous epigrammatists throughout history.
meanings.sent3: The group of friends jokingly referred to themselves as the epigrammatists, always ready with a witty remark.
meanings.sent4: The room buzzed with creativity as the epigrammatists shared their latest works with each other.
meanings.sent5: The anthology featured a collection of epigrammatists' works, highlighting the diversity of their writing styles.
